alert.note: Alert for Hunterdon; Somerset (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 07 at 5:06PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 915 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of northern New Jersey...including the following counties...Hunterdon and Somerset. * WHEN...Until 915 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 503 PM EDT, the water level on the Neshanic River at Reaville was rising from earlier rainfall. Flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the warned area. - For Neshanic at Reaville: At 4:45pm the stage was 6.96 feet. Flood Stage is 6.5 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around...don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
